resources.string:
--SCAI (Computerized System for Smart Trailers)--
 
 Author: Pablo A. Ingaramo (ingaramopablo@gmail.com)
 Date: 06/25/2016
 Info: This app is part of a final project of Computers Engineering degree in FCEFyN (Cordoba National University). This app interacts with webservices provided by a Raspberry Pi 2 and an IP Camera, obtaining information about sensors located in a Truck's trailer.
 
 VIEWS:
 -TIPPER. Shows tipper inclination meassured by LSM9DS0 sensor (Graphic & Numeric).
 -ROLL. Shows side inclination meassured by LSM9DS0 sensor (Graphic & Numeric).
 -COMPASS. Shows orientation measured by LSM9DS0 sensor (Graphic).
 -SENSOR-GROUP STATUS. Displays status of GPS, BerryIMU and IPCamera connections. (Graphic: Red:Offline, Green:Online).
 -SPEED. Calculated based in time delta and GPS position delta (Numeric).
 -PRESSURE. Shows ambient pressure meassured by BMP180 sensor (Numeric).
 -ALTITUDE. Shows altitude in relation to sea level calculated from the ambient pressure (Numeric).
 -DATE AND TIME. Obtained from the Android system (Numeric).
 -MAP VIEW. Offline map created using OSMDroid library and Mobile Atlas Creator. Coordinates obtained from GPS module (Graphic).
 -REARVIEW. Video stream emited by IP Camera (Graphic).
 
 CONFIGURATION MENU:
 -Sensor calibration.
 -RPI Reboot.
 -Web services URL configuration.
INCLINATION. Allign horizontally with the floor both inclination axes and press CALIBRATE.
COMPASS. Point vehicle to north and press CALIBRATE.
TEMPERATURE. Set current temperature in Â°C and press CALIBRATE.
PRESSURE. Set the current pressure in hpa and press CALIBRATE.
